heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

storm.status: The last storm was on 04 September 2025 which lasted for 1 days.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwave.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwave in progress.  So far, 6 heatwaves have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (183°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 51.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.5 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 13 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 3.8°C), dew point temperature (up 2.7°C), inside temperature (up 1.6°C), and outside temperature (up 3.1°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 362.4m higher than yesterday, 638.5m higher than the past week, 347.1m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 767m to 3570m and averaged 2210m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; like a nice, warm day. Also, humidity should not be a concern and calm and still conditions are expected. Drizzle or light rain possible, the sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine, and bright intervals likely. Similar weather conditions should remain.
